data.title: Yedida Y Bogachkov PhD, Author at Friedreich's Ataxia News
data.meta_description: Yedida Y. Bogachkov is a science writer for BioNews. She holds a PhD in cellular and molecular pharmacology from the University of Illinois at Chicago. Prior to joining BioNews, she was conducting scientific research analyzing cancer genomics. She’s a Chicago native and hasn’t moved out of her...
data.text:
Key Health Measures, Height and Weight, Affected by FA at All Ages

Friedriech’s ataxia (FA) affects growth and weight in both adult and children, with the degree of differences from the general public in these key measures of health associated with disease severity, a study based on data from a large patient group reported. While children showed a markedly higher prevalence…

Surveys Point Out Major Motivations and Barriers to Trial Participation

Clinical trials are more attractive to people with ataxias — including those with Friedreich’s ataxia (FA) — when they target specific symptoms, such as walking and balance issues; provide potential benefits to patients and others; and cover costs of travel and accommodation, according to a recent study. These were…
